Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
nosy \nosy\ adj. Offensively or intrusively curious; prying; nosey; as, he flipped through my letters in his nosy way.
Syn: inquisitorial, nosey, prying, snoopy. [WordNet 1.5]

nosy adj : offensively curious or inquisitive; "curious about the neighbor's doings"; "he flipped through my letters in his nosy way"; "prying eyes"; "the snoopy neighbor watched us all day" [syn: {nosey}, {prying}, {snoopy}] [also: {nosiest}, {nosier}]
